alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Elmore, southwestern Camas and northwestern Gooding Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Davis Mountain, or 15 miles southwest of Fairfield, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hill City around 510 PM MDT. Deer Heaven Mountain around 530 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; Western Magic Valley
